content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A fun one! And easy to understand

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Almost perfect.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was fun! I did the puzzle reasonably quickly.

Not necessary, but I would add a test case for numbers not ending in 9. Maybe something simple like 40->44? I know that isn't where the complication is but a challenger may value the incremental progress. Also, allows those who do not figure out the 9 case to do better than those with a null submission.
Updated tests cases to have one like 999 => 1111  (change number of digits)

Great puzzle. The solution is a little hard to understand though.. It basically is adding 1 to a number, finding the rightmost digit which is not 0, and then replicating that digit throughout the rest of the number.

Personally, I would have done it via a string parsing method from right to left, but your method works too!

I love it.
Changed Input description from "A string representing the number [[n]]" to "A growing number [[n]]". Input is not the string, it's a text that you can interpret as a string, number, or whatever.
Thank you, there's a lot of way to solve this puzzle using string will work with all languages. I've put this one because in python it's a little more efficient than my solution with string.
Thank you for approving, I've also added a simple test case, but not 40 -> 40 because here the starting number is not a growing number.
